paragraph: Daniel Travis Davison (born January 28, 1983), is an American musician, songwriter, artist, and filmmaker. He is also a co-founder and former drummer of the band Norma Jean. Davison is also a former drummer of Underoath and Every Time I Die.
section: N/A
== Early life and career ==

paragraph: Davison was born on January 28, 1983 in Douglasville, Georgia.
section: == Early life and career ==
== Early life and career == | === Luti-Kriss ===

paragraph: In 1997, Davison co-founded the band Luti-Kriss and was their drummer.
section: == Early life and career == | === Luti-Kriss ===
== Early life and career == | === Norma Jean ===

paragraph: In 2002, Luti-Kriss changed its name to Norma Jean. In 2007, after 10 years with Norma Jean, Davison decided to part ways with the band and pursue his own artistic endeavors.
section: == Early life and career == | === Norma Jean ===
== Early life and career == | === Colour Revolt ===

paragraph: In early 2010, Davison started playing music again with the indie rock band Colour Revolt. He played several shows with them and recorded drums on their latest record, The Cradle.
section: == Early life and career == | === Colour Revolt ===
== Early life and career == | === Underoath ===

paragraph: In May 2010, Davison succeeded drummer Aaron Gillespie in the band Underoath before the group disbanded in 2013. Davison helped write and record what was thought to be Underoath's final record, Ø (Disambiguation). When Underoath reunited in 2015, Davison was not featured in the new line-up due to Gillespie coming back in the band.
section: == Early life and career == | === Underoath ===
== Early life and career == | === Every Time I Die ===

paragraph: In February 2015, Davison replaced Ryan "Legs" Leger in the band Every Time I Die until 2017.
section: == Early life and career == | === Every Time I Die ===
== Other projects ==
== Other projects == | === Film and video career ===

paragraph: Davison continues to direct and produce music videos when he is not touring.
section: == Other projects == | === Film and video career ===

paragraph: His most recent videos are the final music video for the band Anberlin, for the song "Stranger Ways", and MeWithoutYou's "Dorothy" and "Red Cow". His client list includes:
